senses.sense: (linguistics, lexicography) A copulative or coordinative type of compound in which members, if not compounded, would be in the same case and connected by the conjunction and. Common in languages such as Sanskrit, Chinese and Japanese, but less so in English.
(Sanskrit grammar, lexicography) A form of tatpuruá¹£a in which the modifying member is a number.
(archaic) A doorman, porter, janitor, or groundskeeper in a Russian household
